definition: repeated code/coincident code (i.e. two characters or words having the same encoding)
weight code
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

sentences.english: The contents has repeated coding. We must quickly modify it.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目录重码了，必须赶快修改。

sentences.english: Several classes of binary optimum constant weight codes are obtained by these methods.
sentences.chinese: 通过我们的构造方法可以得到几类二元最优等重码。

sentences.english: In this paper, the trellis complexity of linear constant weight codes is considered.
sentences.chinese: 研究了线性等重码的格子复杂度。

complementary code/binary code with 0 and 1 interchanged
consecutive serial numbers/chain (of supermarkets, hotels etc)/hyphen
remainder (after rounding a number)/decimal part (of number after the decimal point)/mantissa (i.e. fractional part of common logarithm in math.)/small change/balance (of an account)
number/CL:堆[dui1],個|个[ge4]
even number
odd number
Chinese centered dot mark · (punct. used to separate Western names or words)
five stroke input method for Chinese characters by numbered strokes, invented by Wang Yongmin 王永民 in 1983
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

prime number

small figure/small amount/the part of a number to the right of the decimal point (or radix point)/fractional part of a number/number between 0 and 1/decimal fraction
